alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 9:00PM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, CENTRAL TO NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW ANY SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Very strong to potentially damaging wind gusts to around 65 or 70 mph are then possible Tuesday along and east of the central mountain chain as well as over portions of northwest and west central NM. Critical fire weather conditions on Tuesday are expected to be concentrated along and east of the Middle Rio Grande Valley where relative humidity will be lowest. While temperatures will be cooler than normal Wednesday, extremely dry conditions with widespread and long duration single digit relative humidity values will be combined with strong wind speeds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 45 mph Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...4 to 8 percent Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
